result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel F Boiten

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on November 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 007313,
Payable Number: 68457,
Receipt Number: 22R 001998,
Amount: $20.00

10:02 AM Defendant Daniel F Boiten in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms, he does not qualify for PD appiointment. Court has received a petition for court appointed counsel. Court questions defendant as to how much he can pay towards court appointed counsel. Statement by defendant, is waiting on his tax return and should get it in approx 2 weeks. Court addresses the defendant asking if he wants to wait for his check and hire his own attorney. Statement by defendant. Court will put on hold the request for court appointed counsel. No objection by ADA. Court sets for Status of Counsel on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 AM

Court adjourned at 10:04 AM
Second appearance scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Second appearance on May 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Second appearance on April 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:02 AM Defendant Daniel F Boiten in court.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests it's reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant states he applied for the public defender but doesn't qualify. Court determines defendant stands mute and enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on his behalf. Court schedules Status of Counsel for April 19, 2022 at 10:00 AM. ADA McElroy makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 

Court adjourned at 9:05 AM.
